etymologies: early 16th century: alteration of triumph, once used in card games in the same sense

definitions: (in bridge, whist, and similar card games) a playing card of the suit chosen to rank above the others, which can win a trick where a card of a different suit has been led

examples.text: declarer ruffs the opening lead and plays a trump

shortDefinitions: playing card of suit chosen to rank above others

definitions: the suit having the rank above the others in a particular hand
shortDefinitions: suit ranking above others in particular hand

definitions: (in a tarot pack) any of a special suit of 22 cards depicting symbolic and typical figures and scenes.
shortDefinitions: any of special suit of 22 tarot cards

definitions: a valuable resource that may be used, especially as a surprise, in order to gain an advantage

examples.text: in this month General Haig decided to play his trump card: the tank

shortDefinitions: valuable resource that may be used

examples.text: Spencer's doctor is a trump—I am like a new man

definitions: (in bridge, whist, and similar card games) play a trump on (a card of another suit), having no cards of the suit led

examples.text: why on earth did you trump my ace?
declarer trumped the last losing spade in dummy
if he trumped with the 6 or 10, the opponents could overruff

shortDefinitions: (in bridge, whist, and similar card games) play trump on

definitions: beat (someone or something) by saying or doing something better

examples.text: taste trumps most if not all other factors when consumers choose food products

shortDefinitions: surpass something by saying or doing something better

etymologies: Middle English: from Old French trompe, of Germanic origin; probably imitative

definitions: a trumpet or a trumpet blast.
